extendedIngredients.name: bell peppers
extendedIngredients.original: 1 pound (2 pts.) mini multicolored bell peppers, stemmed, seeded, and cut in half lengthwise
extendedIngredients.originalName: (2 pts.) mini multicolored bell peppers, stemmed, seeded, and cut in half lengthwise

extendedIngredients.name: olive oil
extendedIngredients.original: 6 to 7 tbsp. extra-virgin olive oil, divided

extendedIngredients.name: smoked salmon
extendedIngredients.original: 8 thin slices smoked salmon* (4 to 5 oz. total)
extendedIngredients.originalName: thin slices smoked salmon* (4 to 5 oz. total)

extendedIngredients.name: trout filet

title: Pan-fried Trout with Smoked Salmon
summary: Pan-fried Trout with Smoked Salmon is a gluten free, dairy free, and pescatarian main course. This recipe serves 8. For $9.21 per serving, this recipe covers 51% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. One portion of this dish contains roughly 76g of protein, 35g of fat, and a total of 680 calories. If you have trout, salmon, olive oil, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. To use up the kosher salt you could follow this main course with the Low Fat Crumbs Cake (Kosher-Dairy) as a dessert. This recipe from My Recipes has 1 fans. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 40 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 89%. This score is amazing. Try Curried Fried Rice with Smoked Trout, Smoked Salmon Trout Slaw Recipe, and Flash-fried smoked salmon & egg bagel for similar recipes.
instructions: Preheat oven to 150. Sprinkle inside of each trout with salt (use about 1/2 tsp. total). Stuff each with a single layer of smoked salmon, dividing evenly. In a large, shallow dish, combine cornmeal and remaining 1/2 tsp. salt. Turn fish in cornmeal to coat evenly.                                                                                                 Pour 2 tbsp. oil into each of two 12-in. frying pans, preferably nonstick, and warm them over medium heat. (Or warm a large griddle over 2 burners.) Put 3 fish in each pan and saut, turning once, until golden brown outside and no longer translucent in the center, 8 to 9 minutes total; reduce heat if fish start to get too brown. Transfer fish to 1 or 2 large platters and keep warm in oven. Repeat cooking in 1 pan with 1 to 2 more tbsp. oil and remaining fish.                                                                                                 Pour 1 more tbsp. oil into 1 pan (or onto griddle) if it's dry, then set over medium-high heat. Quickly saut peppers until they're softened and lightly browned, about 5 minutes. Sprinkle with salt to taste and scatter on top of fish. Serve with lime wedges.                                                                                                *Use soft, cold-smoked salmon, also called Nova or lox.                                                                                                Note: Nutritional analysis is per serving.

steps.step: Sprinkle inside of each trout with salt (use about 1/2 tsp. total). Stuff each with a single layer of smoked salmon, dividing evenly. In a large, shallow dish, combine cornmeal and remaining 1/2 tsp. salt. Turn fish in cornmeal to coat evenly.

Pour 2 tbsp. oil into each of two 12-in. frying pans, preferably nonstick, and warm them over medium heat. (Or warm a large griddle over 2 burners.) Put 3 fish in each pan and saut, turning once, until golden brown outside and no longer translucent in the center, 8 to 9 minutes total; reduce heat if fish start to get too brown.
Transfer fish to 1 or 2 large platters and keep warm in oven. Repeat cooking in 1 pan with 1 to 2 more tbsp. oil and remaining fish.
Pour 1 more tbsp. oil into 1 pan (or onto griddle) if it's dry, then set over medium-high heat. Quickly saut peppers until they're softened and lightly browned, about 5 minutes.
Sprinkle with salt to taste and scatter on top of fish.
*Use soft, cold-smoked salmon, also called Nova or lox.
